data.text: Why Are Voile Straps So Expensive?!
Why are voile straps so expensive?! Is there a cheaper alternative does anyone know?

data.author: Bill Dove

data.text: In the UK, where I live, no one skis so Voile straps are a rare commodity.
data.author: James Fenn

data.text: but lots of people ride and most models/lengths are not made for skiing. They moved way beyond that years ago. And they are still far superior to any bungee chords. They are far superior in any weather, far more consistent at maintaining their length under force and outlast bungee chords durability 10 fold. So bungee chords are a terrible alternative and because of Voile straps longevity very reasonable price wise.

data.text: Amen brother!!!

data.author: Tim Silvester

data.text:
I really like the bulk Velcro One-Wrap rolls. 30 feet for $11.46! I cut strips to whatever length are needed and place soft side toward bike frame. 1‚Äù wide is nice but sometimes I need 3/4‚Äù to go through bag loops. I simply cut the strap lengthwise to the desired width. Amazingly the edges don‚Äôt even fray. Great stuff for when you don‚Äôt need to take on/off all the time. I actually replace all the various straps that come with my bags with this stuff as it never loosens or mars my paint and there‚Äôs no dangling extra length to flop around. Great for cord wrapping too. https://a.co/bXmL0y7
VELCRO Brand VEL-30768-AMS Wide Straps 1 in x 30 ft Roll | Cut to Length, Reusable Self-Gripping Tape | Bundle Poles, Wood, Pipes, Lumber, Garage Organization for Tool Handles Hoses, More | Black, 1in
amazon.com

data.text: this 100%! Been doing this for years and it‚Äôs super cheap and works great. The Voile-style straps still have a place IMHO but some good ol‚Äô hook and loop solves most problems very well

data.author: Hugh Suffern

data.text: I haven't used the voile straps (though I've been thinking about getting their rack strap). For small things I use velcro cable ties, or hair ties (how I attach my bike pump to my rack). For larger things I use rok straps (they have a bike-specific model), or lately I've been using hiplok z-loks: it's a large sturdy reusable zip tie; trivially easy to adjust / attach / detach, and they also double as ultralight bike locks.

data.text: Voile straps are just very expensive ski straps. So Google ski straps and you will get a lot of cheaper alternatives, some of them looking exactly the same as voile straps. But personally I use Velcro or paracord for strapping.

data.text: Gotta say I thought the same until I got some now I have three sets. Worth it. And yes I am very cheap and have done velcro onestrap bungees rubber bands cam straps the works

data.text: They're less than $10 each. Is that expensive? They're more than worth it. I use about six on my rig.
data.author: Drew Van Patter

data.text:
I bought some called Fix Plus straps from Amazon. They seem to be a German company & were quite a bit cheaper than voile. They worked out about ¬£5 each. I used 2 to temporarily reattach a 7ft x 20ft ish, really heavy fence panel to a concrete fence post after a storm 2 and a half years ago‚Ä¶ the straps are still holding it up & look good as new. We‚Äôve had some much worse storms than the one that took the fence down since then and they‚Äôve held. A testament to their quality & my laziness üòÖ Fixplus - Strap pack of 4 ‚Äì lashing straps for securing, attaching, bundling and lashing ‚Äì made of special plastic with aluminium buckle, 35 cm x 2.4 cm https://amzn.eu/d/ch1fpPq
